meanings.definition: To convert back to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After using the old software, I had to reconvert my files to the new format.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reconvert her room back into a cozy reading nook.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally reconverted my phone to an older version, now it looks like a vintage model!
meanings.sent4: The town's efforts to reconvert the abandoned factory into a community center were successful.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell could reconvert any object into its original form.

meanings.definition: To change back to a former belief or religion.
meanings.sent1: After years of atheism, he felt the need to reconvert to his childhood faith.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reconvert to Buddhism after studying its teachings.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to reconvert to its love for catnip after a long break from it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a compass, always pointing her to reconvert to her true beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The old book seemed to whisper, urging her to reconvert to the ancient ways.
